docs.title: Home
docs.text: Welcome! This page is mostly created to help myself, but I'm glad if you find something useful

docs.title: Cleveland Photographers
docs.text:
Names sorted alphabetically by business name the same way they are in the city directory. All sources for years of operation are from the Cleveland City directories. It's possible the photographer existed before or after the years they appeared in the directory but knowing when they were advertising helps. The directories do NOT run from January to December, but instead July of the starting year, to June of the following year. It can be confirmed they run this way starting at least 1869 - the 1869 directory is for the year ending June 1870, the 1870 directory is for the year ending June 1871, etc.

I have recorded the start year in the tables, so the 1897 reported address is the one reported in the city directory for the year ending July 1898 since that would have been what the photographer reported May or June in 1897.

Ancestry got confused about this (not hard to do) and begins with directories beginning in the indexed year. Then they skip 1879 (which isn't truly missing) then say 1880 is for the year ENDING in 1880 instead of starting in it, thus their 1880 directory should be 1879, and 1881 should be 1880, etc if they had stuck to their initial pattern. Then they are actually missing the directory for the year ending 1901 (what the tables would say is the 1900 directory), and 1901 reverts to the old pattern with year beginning 1901 and ending July 1902.

If you want to see all available photographers for a given year, and the sources for these tables, go to the Cleveland Directories. There are also a lot more photographers there who I have not added tables for. If a photography year is hyperlinked, it links to a findagrave page or familysearch page (free account needed) containing a photo believed to have been taken by the given photographer that year.

docs.title: Beckwith, Alva D.
docs.text:
Previously M. E. Beckwith & Son, Alva only gets one individual entry before the directory returns to the old name

Year Address 1888 261 Pearl, cor. Detroit

docs.title: Beckwith, M. E.
docs.text:
He is consistently referred to as M. E. Beckwith unless stated otherwise.

Year Address 1861 none 1862 ? 1863 9 Pearl (Note: Name given Marvin E. Beckwith) 1864 9 Pearl, w. s. (up stairs) 1865 9 Pearl, up stairs 1866 9 Pearl 1867 12 Pearl 1868 ? 1869 115 Hammond (Note: called Marion E.)

This business becomes M.E. Beckwith & Son

Note: The 'son' seems to take over M. E. Beckwith and son briefly. 1888 has an entry "Beckwith, Alva D.Beckwith, Alva D., Successor to M. E. Beckwith & Son". However, 1889 the directory returns to the old name.

docs.title: Freedle, J. W.
docs.text:
Name appears 'Freedle' on the sample photo cards I have found, J. W. Freedle in the directory

Year Address 1875 Not Listed as photographer 1876 225 Superior 1877 225 Superior 1878 225 Superior 1879 225 Superior 1880 225 Superior 1881 225 Superior 1882 225 Superior 1883 225 Superior 1884 225 Superior

This becomes Freedle, J. W. & Bro. beginning 1885. There is a Freedle, James W. Entry in 1899 at 1667 Broadway, where Baclav was the previous year - more research needs to be done to determine if it's the same as this one.
